content: I purchased this app for an Acer Chromebook Spin( works as laptop or tablet). Chromebooks are a very popular elementary student option. I am very dissapointed ( and suprised) that this app does not work on it! I have now spent $40 on an app ( we also use an ipad with no issue), which is expensive in the first place, and now I have to use a "workaround" to get the tiles to clear from board.
replyContent:
Hi Cristina, I'm sorry about that. Chromebook is actually not supported at this time--the app was made for tablets only--see which ones here: https://www.allaboutlearningpress.com/letter-tiles-app/#FAQ.

Email me at support@allaboutlearningpress.com, and I'd be happy to help you get a refund! ~Merry

content: This app is great, a little pricey but worth it. However it would be nice to have a "clear board" setting as well as display the letters in random order so that the first part of every lesson - which is putting the tiles in alphabetical order could be done.

Thanks for your suggestion for random order--I'll pass that on to our developer! You can also practice alphabetizing with the phonogram cards. More ideas here: https://blog.allaboutlearningpress.com/alphabetizing/

Thanks!

content: Keeps crashing on my Samsung Note 9. Won't even open. Need help please!
replyContent: Unfortunately the app is not available for phones. The bank of tiles would be too tiny as there are 165 letter and word part tiles plus syllable tags. See https://www.allaboutlearningpress.com/letter-tiles-app/ for compatible devices. If you don't have a tablet for the app, please contact support@allaboutlearningpress.com for help with a refund.

content: We love AAS and this app makes it even easier. Now we can take spelling on the go, not worry about losing tiles and my daughter thinks it's fun. Thanks for a great curriculum and app.
replyContent: You're welcome; enjoy!

content: First of all, make sure it will work on your device. 4 tablets in our house and it only works on one. I don't know about everyone else but this homeschool mama doesn't have money to buy all the kids new tablets so they can have this app.  The concept is great. I like that we won't run out of letters if we want to build multiple words.  It's nice that we don't have to worry about losing tiles and with one swipe all the letters are back where they need to be! And so portable if we want to take it on the go. There are things that would make this app great. The first you have already somewhat fixed--making words easier to divide (for me. It's still hard for my 10 year old. He has epilepsy and can only use one hand and it's hard to divide words with one hand.). But it would be nice if there was an easier way to put the syllables back together to make the big word without moving each individual tile again.  And it would be awesome if there was a way for the app to read the words or individual syllables. I know this isn't a crazy concept--leapfrog can do it with their fridge phonics word builder toy.  Overall, the app is okay. I don't think it was worth paying the sale price of $15.
replyContent: Thanks, Erin! Weâ€™ll continue to look at syllable division. To put words back together, you can 2 finger drag on words or word parts. We don't plan to have the app sound out words--the student should sound out the words with a parent or teacher to analyze any mistakes. Simply reading a word for a child doesn't help them know why they were wrong.

content: I can't divide the syllables on my 7" screen. :(  Will this be fixed?
replyContent: Hi Maggie, I'm sorry you're having trouble. There should be an update now to fix this. If that doesn't work, please email us at support@allaboutlearningpress.com so we can trouble-shoot with you. We definitely want to help you have a 5-star experience!

content: The bugs have been fixed!  Tiles are larger, so easier for my child to grab, they now move around with ease and syllables also now divide without any problem.  This is a great add-on to the curriculum and great for doing our lessons on the go.  Loved the concept of the big magnet board, but it just seemed like the natural progression to move to the tablet and now the app has all the same capabilities.  Thank you!!
replyContent: Great! I'm glad it's working well for you now! Thanks for your review :-)

content: Love the idea of the app instead of trying to keep our magnetic tiles organized.
